questions.title: How are you preparing for peak volume periods?
questions.description: It is important that a Contact Center is periodically performance tested in preparation for peak volumes and seasonality.

choices.title: Performing periodic Load or Scale Testing

helpfulResource.displayText: Performance Load and Scale testing should be performed on a periodic basis to ensure your Contact Center can perform duing periods of increased or peak volumes.

improvementPlan.displayText: Review the Amazon Connect Testing Policy to ensure testing is performed withing the operating guidelines.

choices.title: Using empirical capacity planning data to staff the correct amount of agents

helpfulResource.displayText: A capacity plan helps you estimate the amount of agents are required to meet the service level target for a certain period of time.

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider using Forecasting, Capacity Planning and Scheduling within Amazon Connect to determine the amount of agents to staff based on historical data.

choices.title: Confirming Service Quotas are at an acceptable level

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect default service quotas may not be sufficient for your organization during peak times.

improvementPlan.displayText: Review the default Amazon Connect Service Quotas. If a service quota needs to be increased, use the Service Quota service found in the AWS Console.

helpfulResource.displayText: Choose this option if your workload does not follow these best practices.

questions.title: How are you enabling your agents?
questions.description: Enabling agents is an important part of a Well Architected Contact Center. If agents can be enabled to increase First Call Resolution or lower Average Handle Time, this will create a better experience for all involved parties as well as drive down operational costs.

choices.title: A Custom CCP is being used

helpfulResource.displayText: Significant performance efficiency can be realized through the creation of custom agent desktop solutions using the Amazon Connect Streams API.

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider using the Streams API to create customized CCP's for your agents to increase performance efficiency.

choices.title: Amazon Connect is integrated with a CRM

helpfulResource.displayText: With a CRM integration, your agents can get a comprenehsive view of customer and contact information in a single interface without managing multiple screens and interfaces

improvementPlan.displayText: Evaluate if a CCP can be embedded into the CRM used by your organization.

helpfulResource.displayText: Common and repeatable tasks are automated for your agents. For example, automatically creating cases or pre-filling webforms and offering a screen pop with relevant information when a contact is offered.

improvementPlan.displayText: Evaluate what repeatable processes or jobs are performed by agents and determine if Tasks can be used to improve automation.

choices.title: Enhanced Capabilities have been built into the CCP

helpfulResource.displayText: CCP functionality can be extended/enhanced to include real-time Transcriptions, Translations, Suggested Actions and Knowledge base integrations.

improvementPlan.displayText: Integrate enhanced capabilities with your agent desktop to allow skilled agents to service contacts more efficiently and unskilled agents to provide service when skilled agents arent available. For example, you can use this approach to automatically translate a chat contact for unskilled agents that don't know the language. When your agent replies, you can automatically translate the text to the contacts language, allowing for real-time bilingual communication.

helpfulResource.displayText: Choose this option if your workload does not follow these best practices.

questions.title: Is your Contact Center leveraging other AWS Services?
questions.description: Amazon Connect natively works with a number of other AWS Services to improve performance, identify areas of opportunity, and gain valuable insights into your contact data

helpfulResource.displayText: You can use AWS Lambda un you Amazon Connect contact flows to perform data dips for customer information, send SMS text messages, and with other services like Amazon S3  to automatically distribute scheduled repots.

improvementPlan.displayText: Determine what self-service or automation options you'd like to provide to customers, agents and supervisors and evaluate how AWS Lambda could help ahchieve desired functionality.

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect offers a native integration with Amazon Polly, allowing you to play dynamic and natural Text-to-Speech (TTS), use Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML), and take advantageof Neural Text-to-Speech (NTTS) to achieve the most natural and human-like text-to-speech voices possible.

improvementPlan.displayText: Explore the many different language, voice and dialect options available in Amazon Polly which can be used in Amazon Connect to provide a custom and familiar experience to customers.

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Lex is a service that allows you to create intelligent conversational chatbots. It lets you turnyour Amazon Connect contact center contact flows into natural conversations that provide personalizedexperiences for your caller.

improvementPlan.displayText: Work with your Contact Center agents and supervisors to understand the common topics that customers call in about. If these topics can be built into a conversational bot, evaluate how Amazon Lex could faciliate those interactions with your callers.

helpfulResource.displayText: For situations where you need to gain additional insight from your contact metrics and real-time data from Amazon Connect, you can leverage Amazon Kinesis to stream data to dashboard and reporting tools.

improvementPlan.displayText: Evaulate any current reporting and dashboard tools used within your organization and understand how Amazon Kinesis can stream data from Connect to these tools. If your organization doesn't have tools that allow you to process and query real-tiome and historical data from Amazon Connect, consdier using Amazon Opensearch Service or Kibana.

helpfulResource.displayText: Choose this option if your workload does not follow these best practices.

questions.title: How are agents accessing information required to serve the contact?
questions.description: Agents are one of the biggest cost component in contact center solutions. Streamlining processes and tools for the agent to access information will improve agent productivity, which in-turn will reduce agent costs.

choices.title: Working with multiple systems or screens

helpfulResource.displayText: Are agents leveraging multiple systems or tools and going out of CCP to collect the information needed to serve the contacts?

improvementPlan.displayText: Amazon Connect is an open platform that allows quick and easy integration with other apps and 3rd party systems so that agents can serve the contacts without leaving CCP. Refer to various Amazon Connect capabilities like Invoke Lambda , Amazon Connect Agents Apps, Amazon Connect Customers Profile, Amazon Connect Tasks, Amazon Connect Wisdom features and Amazon Connect Stream APIs to build a unified and rich user experience for agent that not only provides relevant and contextual information from various systems and apps in one place (CCP) but also allows agents to take actions like create ticket in ITSM or update Customer information in CRM etc from CCP.

helpfulResource.displayText: Metrics like Call Transfer-in / Out, Call Transfer-out by agent etc can provide meaningful insights and data around call routing. Optimizing these metrics can help improve agent's productivity and reduce cost.

improvementPlan.displayText: Refer documentation on how to setup contact transfers and leverage features like Transfer contact to specific agent and Queue To Queue transfer that allow you to automatically transfer calls from one queue to another in your contact flow. This lets you minimize call wait times in your contact center, adjust to changing call patterns dynamically, or to assign calls to more qualified agents. You can use metrics, such as agent availability or the number of calls in the queue, to determine which queue to route the call to. To do this,, first create a customer queue contact flow, then define the conditions for transferring calls using blocks in your contact flow. Finally, use a transfer to queue block in your contact flow to enable calls to automatically transfer to the desired queue.

choices.title: CCP is auto-populated with desired information to guide and assist the agent

helpfulResource.displayText: Are there any intelligence added to CCP to provide real-time assistance to agent serving the contact?

improvementPlan.displayText: Leverage Amazon Connect Customer Profiles, Contact Lens, Wisdom and Voice ID features of Amazon Connect to auto-populate the information and provide additional context and guidance in near real-time to improve agents effectiveness in serving the contacts.

choices.title: Agents leverage SOPs and their experience to best serve the contact

helpfulResource.displayText: Are appropriate SOPs in place for agents to refer and being evaluated periodically for their effectiveness?

improvementPlan.displayText: Have appropriate Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for agents to follow as well as implement means to monitor and enforce compliance and governance of them. You can leverage platform features like Amazon Connect Contact Lens, Stream APIs and CTR records etc to realize governance and monitoring. For more details on Contact Lens, refer Amazon Connect documentation.

questions.title: What call deflection strategy is in place ?
questions.description: It's highly encouraged have a call deflection strategy as it can help significantly reduce the cost.

choices.title: Provide callback options, in case of long queue

helpfulResource.displayText: Is the expected wait time and queue depth monitored and used to provide callback options to contacts? Long wait times in contact center queues are a key driver for customer frustration. They also increase costs to companies.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement callback options considering things like queue status, time in queue, staff availability / hours of operation etc. Another good place to offer callbacks is the transfer to queue node. While you can check queue capacity within the check queue status node, transfer to queue is the last node in the IVR and will contain the most recent queue data. Depending on how complex your call flow is this might be a better point in the call experience to route callers to a callback menu option.Once we use a branch node to asses the status and the caller is aware there are no immediately available agents, it makes sense to offer them a callback option through a get customer input node. Refer these docs on how to implement callbacks.

helpfulResource.displayText: Are the IVR systems fronting the agent to serve the contacts?

improvementPlan.displayText: Utilize services like Amazon Lex bots to implement call deflection strategy. You can further improve the customer experience and reduce the cost by leveraging features like Voice ID to automate authentication etc.

choices.title: Detect theme across issues and proactive reach-out for common issues

helpfulResource.displayText: Proactively identify call patterns or trends for a potential of mass communication on common issues, system-wide problems, trends etc.

improvementPlan.displayText: Use features like Amazon Connect Contact Lens Theme Detection , High Volume Outbound communication in conjunction with Amazon Pinpoint, or Contact Trace Records (CTR) and Stream APIs to identify themes and categorization of issues to drive proactive actions and reach-out to contacts on common issues / patterns / trends which in-turn will help drive down the inbound calls and hence cost.

helpfulResource.displayText: Do you offer other channels to contacts seeking assistance e.g. Chat, Email etc?

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement an omni-channel based contact center solution on Amazon Connect using Amazon Connect Streaming APIs , native channels,  and other services like Amazon Pinpoint, and SNS.

questions.title: What procedure do you follow to ensure agents utilization ?
questions.description: There are several procedures like SOPs, training and compliance as well as forecasting items that can help improve agents utilization.

helpfulResource.displayText: Are Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) being periodically reviewed and/or updated for its accuracy and effectiveness?

improvementPlan.displayText: To monitor and enforce compliance and governance of the procedures, you can leverage  platform features like Contact Lens, Stream APIs and CTR records etc

choices.title: Capacity planning accurately forecasting the staff

helpfulResource.displayText: Is staff forecasting and capacity planning accurate for both short-term and log term forecast?

improvementPlan.displayText: Ensure that Workforce management capacity planning and forecasting module in use is appropriately setup and accounting for any changes in contact volumes, patterns, seasonality etc along with agents schedules, performance etc. to accurately forecast the staffing, for both short-term and long-term forecast.

choices.title: Periodic coaching and training of Amazon Connect users

helpfulResource.displayText: Keeping agents up-to-date with use of SOPs and platform / tools is key to their ability to effectively use the resources. Are Amazon Connect users (agents, supervisors etc) being regularly trained and kept up-to-date on the resources and tools available at their disposal to serve the contacts.

improvementPlan.displayText: Account for training time in resource schedule in the Workforce management scheduling and forecasting module to ensure timely and regular training of agents on the resources / tools etc. Leverage and/or create and update resources and mechanisms like agents training guide , internal resources and knowledge bases, SOPs, and evaluation process to gauge effectiveness of the training.

choices.title: Agents schedule aligned to contacts volume and other activities

helpfulResource.displayText: Are the agents schedule created keeping all activities and considerations in mind, including but not only limited to contact volumes and trainings ?

improvementPlan.displayText: Make sure to create agents schedule (both for short term and long term) keeping expected volumes, seasonality, shrinkage, time offs (planned and unplanned), training etc activities in mind.

questions.title: Have you reviewed telephony and inbound call routes for the opportunities, if any, to optimize telephony cost?
questions.description: Telephony being another major cost element, its important to apply considerations in choosing the right telephony to optimize cost.

choices.title: Calls routed from the 3rd party managed phone number to Amazon Connect claimed number

helpfulResource.displayText: Are the customer facing number(s) dialed in by contacts owned and managed by 3rd party in order to route calls to Amazon Connect?

improvementPlan.displayText: Considering porting the numbers over to Amazon Connect (subject to regional availability, country and legal rules etc.) and leveraging Amazon Connect native capabilities like Contact Flow to realize the routing. This will eliminate some of the call legs in the flow contributing to the cost and may help reduce operations cost of the solution. Refer to the link for more info.

choices.title: No intermediate hops in the call flow managed outside of Amazon Connect

helpfulResource.displayText: There are no intermediate hops in between the phone number dialed by Contacts and Amazon Connect claimed number(s) to route the Contacts to agent

improvementPlan.displayText: Consider having customer dialed number directly route to Amazon claimed phone numbers as opposed to keeping any intermediate hops in between. This will help remove the unnecessary cost due to additional hops for any non customer facing numbers outside of Amazon Connect

choices.title: No Telephony outbound for Integration to external systems

helpfulResource.displayText: Does the end to end call flow involve transfer out to external systems for e.g. 3rd party IVR?

improvementPlan.displayText: PSTN call transfers out to a 3rd Party IP telephony system can add to your Amazon Connect spend because the calls are still pinned to Connect for the duration of the transfer.  It's highly advised to streamline the call flow and avoid one or more call transfer out between Amazon and 3rd party systems, if possible. As this will not only help with our customer experience and operations but will also help reduce the Amazon Connect telephony and/or platform service minute costs when outbound transfers cannot be avoided. Connect SAs can review the call flow etc. and determine the next best options available. Work with an Amazon Connect specialist to identify the most appropriate design catering to your customer experience goals.

choices.title: Considered appropriate Telephony type for numbers claimed on Amazon Connect

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect offers Direct in-dial (DID) and Toll Free numbers (TFN) for telephony managed by Amazon Connect. Have appropriate considerations been taken into account in choosing between DIDs and TFNs.

improvementPlan.displayText: Though Toll free numbers provide additional resiliency, it comes with additional cost when compared with DIDs. Apply your workload's availability and resiliency requirements in choosing right telephony numbers. Refer documentation for additional details on DIDs and TFNs in Amazon Connect

questions.title: How is the region for Amazon Connect instance determined for your Contact Center solution deployment?
questions.description: Amazon Connect Region is one of the first decision customers make when adopting Amazon Connect for their contact center workloads. Telephony pricing for Claimed Phone Numbers Per Day and Per Minute Inbound Usage can be different for countries depending upon the AWS Region in which you select to instantiate your Amazon Connect Instance.

choices.title: Same region as the country of business

helpfulResource.displayText: Amazon Connect instance is deployed in the AWS region as the country of your business

improvementPlan.displayText: Review the recommendation to further ensure appropriate setup

choices.title: Different region(s) than country of business

helpfulResource.displayText: Is your Amazon Connect instance deployed to AWS region different from the country of your business?

improvementPlan.displayText: If you require to have the Amazon Connect instance in a different regions than the country of business (agent vs customers), consider the most cost effective phone call (inbound/outbound) costs

choices.title: A combination of country of business and Amazon Connect region

helpfulResource.displayText: Chose this option if your agents and contacts are in a different country

improvementPlan.displayText: Optimize the inbound/outbound call costs based on the customer's and agent's country and Amazon Connect region.
